docstr: `ACOS` — Arccosine function ### Description `ACOS(X)` computes the arccosine of `X` (inverse of `COS(X)`). ### Syntax `RESULT = ACOS(X)` ### Arguments with a magnitude that is less than or equal to one - or the type shall be `COMPLEX`. ### Return value The return value is of the same type and kind as `X`. The real part of the result is in radians and lies in the range 0 \leq \Re \acos(x) \leq \pi. ### Example ``` program test_acos   real(8) :: x = 0.866_8   x = acos(x) end program test_acos ``` ### Specific names | Name | Argument | Return type | Standard | `ACOS(X)` | `REAL(4) X` | `REAL(4)` | Fortran 77 and later | `DACOS(X)` | `REAL(8) X` | `REAL(8)` | Fortran 77 and later ### Standard Fortran 77 and later, for a complex argument Fortran 2008 or later ### Class Elemental function ### See also Inverse function: COS
